availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mary Eliza South Trimble (Breathitt and Franklin County, KY, resident)

body.p: Breathitt and Franklin County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Daughter of Jeremiah W. South and Mary Magdalene Cockrell South. Married to Asbury Trimble on July 7, 1863. Mother of Asbury South Trimble. Resident of Breathitt County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Breathitt County in 1850. Resident of Frankfort, Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Frankfort in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 33A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 277.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 492B.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970, National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, Louisville, KY, National 25348, State 364.
"Death of Mrs. Trimble," The Evening Bulletin (Maysville, Kentucky), March 19, 1900, p. 4.
"Mary Elizabeth South Trimble (1830-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial 61830521, accessed February 19, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61830521.
